page.title: 07Maes-y-groes Farm,Cilcain(1)
page.content: Agriculture in this area is generally based on beef/dairy cattle and sheep. Maes-y-groes Farm (G.R.185648) totals 80ha: 48ha at the farm and a separated block of 32ha of poorer grazing at Cwm Llydan,to the southwest, on the lower slopes of the Clwydian Hills. Most of the land is pasture, grazed by beef- cattle and sheep, but 16ha is used to produce hay or silage and 12ha to grow barley, all used as winter livestock fodder.Both artificial fertilizers and farmyard manure are used to keep the soil in good condition.The usual range of farm machinery includes a combine- harvester for cutting the barley. Specialization in just two enterprises (beef and sheep) means that normally the farm is run by only one man:casual labour is employed when necessary, and silage production is carried out by contract.
